passage:
(1) Metals are excellent conductors of electricity, a property that makes them essential in our modern world. When we flip a switch to turn on a light or plug in a device, electricity flows through metal wires to power our homes and gadgets. But have you ever wondered why metals conduct electricity so well while materials like plastic or wood do not?

(2) To understand why metals conduct electricity, we need to look at their atomic structure. All metals have a specific arrangement of atoms where the outermost electrons are loosely held. These electrons, often called 'free electrons' or 'conduction electrons,' are not tightly bound to any particular atom. Instead, they form what scientists describe as an 'electron sea' that flows throughout the entire metal.

(3) When we apply an electric voltage to a piece of metal, these free electrons begin to move in a specific direction. This organized movement of electrons is what we call an electric current. The more freely these electrons can move, the better the metal conducts electricity. Some metals, like copper and silver, have particularly mobile electrons, making them excellent conductors used in electrical wiring and circuits.

(4) Temperature also affects how well metals conduct electricity. Generally, as temperature increases, metals become less effective conductors. This happens because the atoms vibrate more at higher temperatures, creating more obstacles for the moving electrons. This property is why some electronic devices may overheat and stop working properly if they get too hot.

(5) Understanding the conductive properties of metals has allowed engineers to develop better electrical systems and electronic devices. By selecting the right metals for specific applications, we can create more efficient electrical grids, faster computers, and more reliable electronic equipment. The remarkable ability of metals to conduct electricity has become fundamental to our technological progress.

questions.question: Which form of the verb is correct? She _____ to the cinema last weekend.
Choose the correct preposition: The book is _____ the table.
Select the correct form: If it _____ tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic.
Which sentence is grammatically correct?
Choose the correct comparative form: This building is _____ than our house.
Which is the correct past participle? They have _____ their homework.
Select the correct article: I saw _____ interesting movie last night.
Which modal verb is appropriate? You _____ wear a seatbelt while driving. It's the law.
Choose the correct form of the verb: She _____ for two hours when I called her.
Identify the correct passive voice: The window _____.
Which sentence contains a correctly used relative pronoun?

options.A: The woman who house I visited is a doctor.
options.B: The woman whose house I visited is a doctor.
options.C: The woman which house I visited is a doctor.
options.D: The woman whom house I visited is a doctor.

questions.question: Select the correct future form: This time next week, I _____ on a beach in Spain.
Choose the correct question form: _____ to the party last night?
Which sentence uses the correct form of the gerund?

options.A: I enjoy to swim in the ocean.
options.B: I enjoy swimming in the ocean.
options.C: I enjoy swim in the ocean.
options.D: I enjoying swim in the ocean.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence with reported speech: He said, 'I am tired.'

options.D: He said that I was tired.

questions.question: Complete the sentence with the appropriate word: The weather was bad, _____ we still went to the beach.
Choose the correct phrasal verb: Could you please _____ these forms for me?
Select the appropriate expression: She's very busy at work and is _____ a lot of pressure.
Choose the correct idiom to complete the sentence: I was so nervous during my presentation that I completely _____.
Select the best word to complete the sentence: She gave a very _____ explanation that everyone understood.
Choose the best collocation: He needs to _____ a decision about his future soon.
Select the correct connector: I studied hard, _____ I failed the exam.
Choose the appropriate preposition: They arrived _____ the airport on time.
Select the correct form to complete the sentence: We've run out of milk. Would you mind _____ some on your way home?
Choose the correct quantifier: There isn't _____ evidence to support your claim.
The museum will _____ a special exhibition of ancient artifacts next month.
The courier will _____ your package tomorrow morning.
It's important to _____ people when they make mistakes.
She didn't _____ that she had already seen the movie.
I couldn't _____ between the two desserts, so I ordered both.
The solution to the problem doesn't _____ very difficult.
How much does a ticket to the concert _____?
This factory _____ more than 1000 cars per month.
Do you _____ where the nearest bank is?
We need to assess the _____ before making a decision.
She didn't _____ to my email until three days later.
Can you help me _____ this heavy box onto the shelf?
You need to bring a valid identity _____ to enter the building.
The meeting will _____ until all issues have been resolved.
It's important to _____ a healthy lifestyle if you want to stay fit.
According to paragraph 1, why are metals essential in our modern world?

options.A: Because they are shiny and attractive
options.C: Because they are used to make light switches
options.D: Because they are stronger than other materials

questions.question: What does the term 'free electrons' refer to in paragraph 2?

options.B: Electrons that have escaped from atoms
options.C: Outermost electrons that are loosely held
options.D: Electrons that move at high speeds

questions.question: According to the passage, what is an electric current?

options.A: The application of voltage to a metal
options.B: The organized movement of electrons in a specific direction
options.C: The electron sea found in metals
options.D: The process of electrons becoming free

questions.question: Which metals are mentioned as excellent conductors used in electrical wiring?
How does temperature affect metals' ability to conduct electricity?

options.B: Temperature has no effect on conductivity
options.C: Higher temperatures cause metals to become better conductors

questions.question: Why do metals become less effective conductors at higher temperatures?

options.B: The atoms vibrate more, creating obstacles for electrons
options.D: The metal expands and becomes less dense

questions.question: What is the main purpose of paragraph 5?

options.A: To explain how electronic devices work
options.B: To discuss the future of metal production
options.C: To highlight the importance of understanding metal conductivity in technology
options.D: To compare different types of metals

questions.question: The word 'remarkable' in paragraph 5 is closest in meaning to:
Based on the passage, which of the following statements is TRUE?

options.A: All materials conduct electricity equally well
options.B: Electronic devices work better at higher temperatures
options.C: Understanding metal conductivity has helped develop better technology
options.D: Metals conduct electricity because they are dense

questions.question: What can be inferred from the passage about materials like plastic or wood?

options.B: Their electrons are more tightly bound than in metals
options.C: They conduct electricity better than metals
options.D: They have more free electrons than metals
